intro: Sesleria marginata, commonly known as the marginated sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, stream banks, and damp woodlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes during the spring and summer months. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
